page.title: 03Medstead Information Centre
page.content:
The Medstead Information centre has the only purpose built information centre out of all the schools in Hampshire. The information centre is unique for its computers and computer technology. It is one of the nine schools in Europe which has been chosen for the IBM project. (The IBM project is an experiment to see how children cope with the IBM programs).
It has five IBM computers and three BBC computers. It has carpets, unlike most other schools. It is probably the first primary school with a modem which is linked up to the Times network which is at present supposed to be only available to secondary schools and colleges. It is a very complex centre and needs a lot of organisation. cont/page 4
